## Conversion Function

```{R Assignment 1}
#Define a function to convert between milliliter and microliter 
#Number = volume in microliter (ul) or milliliter (ml)
#Unit = measurement units (ul or ml)
#1 ml = 1000ul 

convertml_ul <- function(value, unit){
   if(unit=="ml"){
    result= round(number*1000,6)
    return(paste(result,"ul"))
  }
  else if(direction=="ul"){
    result=round(number/1000,5)
    return(paste(result,"ml"))
  }
  else{
    return("Error:please input unit")
  }
  return(result)
}

convertml_ul(100, "ml")#expected result is 0.1
convertml_ul(100, "ul")#expected result is 100,000

knitr::opts_chunk$set(echo = TRUE)
```

## Data Frame

```{R Assignment 2 Emeralds}
library(ggplot2)
library(dplyr)

Large <- Emeralds %,%
  filter(carat <=[between(x,100,500)]
```

## Including Plots

```{R Assignment 2 Emeralds }
large %>%
  ggplot(aes(carat))+ Frequence(binwidth = 100)
plot(large)
```

#Summary 'EMERALD' data sets measures large carat sizes between 100 and 500 at a frequency carat values in increments of 100 in the plot.
